title.value: Willingness to engage in shared decision making: Impact of an educational intervention for resident physicians (SDM-FM)
title.justification: Identified from the Title section of the provided research paper.
title.quote:
Title
Willingness to engage in shared decision making: Impact of an educational intervention for resident physicians (SDM-FM)

extractions.description: This study evaluates the willingness of Family Medicine (FM) residents to engage in shared decision making (SDM) before and after an educational intervention consisting of a lecture and workshop. The study uses the incorpoRATE measure to assess willingness at two different time points.

type.justification: The paper evaluates the willingness of FM residents to engage in SDM before and after an intervention, involving data collection and analysis of scores.
type.quote: We summarized the T1 scores and evaluated within-resident changes between T1 and T2 incorpoRATE scores.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on evaluating and educating Family Medicine residents, which falls under Medical Education.
name.quote: Thus, we evaluated the willingness of FM residents to engage in SDM, before and after an educational intervention.

name.justification: The study focuses on the willingness of residents to engage in shared decision making (SDM), making this a significant subfield.
name.quote: We know little about the willingness of Family Medicine (FM) residents to engage in shared decision making (SDM).
